bib.title: -Neutron Total Cross-Sections In The Energy Range 15 To 120 Mev-

free_txt: P.Bowen, J.Scanlon, G.Stafford, J.Thresher.
P.E.Hodgson.
Harwell Cyclotron.
M.M. BIB information was added.
Dates were corrected for 4-digits year.
Free text was corrected to be human-readable.
EN-ERR was changed into EN-RSL-FW according to title
of Table 1 of reference and text, p.647.
Subents 009, 010 were added.
-Corrections for counting losses (less 2%), pulse
pile-up and background. Background correction made by
blocking the transmitted beam with 1.25 m of steel.
-Corrections for plural scattering and impurities in
the absorbers were less than 0.2 % and were neglected.
Fast organic scintillators, 4 cm in diameter
and 2 cm thick, used to count transmitted
neutrons and monitor the flux.
Both detectors viewed by RCA 6342 photo-
multipliers.
-Only statistical counting errors are given. Other
random errors believed to be negligible.
-Systematic errors believed to be less than 2 %
for hydrogen,less than 1% for the other cross section.
-Uncertainties in energy about 2 % due to error in
calibrating the time-sorter.
-Upper limits of errors due time resolution varied from
0.2% at 100 MeV to 0.5% at 117.5 MeV.
Harwell Cyclotron.
.protons incident on thick aluminum  target.
.Neutrons produced in 16 ns (full width), 9 ns(FWHM),
bursts at intervals of 5 milli-sec.
Spectrum of neutrons  produced was continuous and
extends up to a max.energy of about 135 MeV.
Collimators A1 to A5 were used for main beam.
Time-of-flight transmission method with 27 m
flight path giving a resolution of 0.33 ns/m
or about 3.5 % at 15 MeV to 12.5 % at 130 MeV.
Good geometry transmission measurement to
determine the neutron total cross-section.
Neutron TOF
spectrometer details.
From NEUDADA. Data also in Table 1 of Nucl.
.Cylindrical carbon rod checked for absence of blow
holes and other internal flaws. Length and density
measured to better than 0.1 % . Transmission about
0.1 at 50 MeV .
From NEUDADA. Data also in Table 1 of Reference
Data of
Subent 002 for carbon  c-s were used.
.Sample used with carbon sample in carbon-polyethylene
difference measurement to obtain the hydrogen cross-
section.
.Cylindrical polyethylene rod checked for the absence
of blow holes and other internal flaws. length and
density measured to 0.1% . Sample had the same surface
density of carbon as the carbon absorber.
From NEUDADA. Data also in Table 1 of

measured to better than 0.1 % . Transmission  about
0.1 at 50 MeV.
